page.title: 15FARMING AT CALDER VALE
page.content:
LOWER LANDSKILL FARM This is a typical small hill farm. The farmer has one part-time worker to help him.
They have 11 fields. 24 acres are used for hay and silage. The rest is used for grazing. There are 68 acres altogether. The average size of a field in hectares is 27.5.
They have 54 cattle altogether, 23 pigs that they breed and they have 40 sheep, 58 lamb, 5 hens, and 14 ducks.They have one tractor and they rent the farm.
The milk tanker comes each morning to collect the milk. It is then taken to the dairy at Longridge.
